intro: Pleurothallis stumpflei, commonly known as the Stumpf's pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and deriving moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. Its leaves are usually narrow and elongated, adapted to capture light in the dense canopy of its habitat. Pleurothallis stumpflei is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its delicate beauty and unique floral structure.
